extendedIngredients.name: chicken stock
extendedIngredients.original: 4 1/2 tablespoons chicken stock or canned low-sodium broth

extendedIngredients.name: napa cabbage

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper

extendedIngredients.name: white pepper

title: Shrimp Stir-Fried with Napa Cabbage
summary: Need a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course? Shrimp Stir-Fried with Napa Cabbage could be an amazing recipe to try. For $1.72 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 117 calories, 14g of protein, and 4g of fat. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have bell pepper, cornstarch, water, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 47%. This score is solid. Try Stir-fried Napa Cabbage, Stir Fried Napa Cabbage With Mushrooms And Bacon, and Stir-fried Napa Cabbage With Garlic, Fresh Chile & Basil for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the cabbage ribs and cook for 10 seconds. Add the leaves and cook for 20 seconds. Drain the cabbage and rinse under cold water; drain well.                                              In a small bowl, combine the chicken stock with the cornstarch, black soy sauce, sesame oil and white pepper to make the sauce.                                              Warm a wok over high heat for 45 seconds. Add the peanut oil and swirl to coat the wok. Add the ginger and cook for 10 seconds. Stir in the garlic and cook for 10 seconds. Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook, turning once, until they begin to turn pink and curl up, about 15 seconds per side. Add all the cabbage and stir-fry for 2 1/2 minutes. Make a well in the center, pushing the mixture to the side of the wok. Stir the sauce and pour it into the well. Bring to a simmer, stir-frying to blend. Transfer to a platter, sprinkle with the bell pepper and serve.

steps.step: Bring the water to a boil in a large saucepan.
Add the cabbage ribs and cook for 10 seconds.
Add the leaves and cook for 20 seconds.
Drain the cabbage and rinse under cold water; drain well.
In a small bowl, combine the chicken stock with the cornstarch, black soy sauce, sesame oil and white pepper to make the sauce.
Warm a wok over high heat for 45 seconds.
Add the peanut oil and swirl to coat the wok.
Add the ginger and cook for 10 seconds. Stir in the garlic and cook for 10 seconds.
Add the shrimp in a single layer and cook, turning once, until they begin to turn pink and curl up, about 15 seconds per side.

Add all the cabbage and stir-fry for 2 1/2 minutes. Make a well in the center, pushing the mixture to the side of the wok. Stir the sauce and pour it into the well. Bring to a simmer, stir-frying to blend.
Transfer to a platter, sprinkle with the bell pepper and serve.
